title: Domaine Delaporte 2014  Sancerre
description: Ripe and fruity, this is still so fresh. Along with its crisp citrus flavors and touch of minerality, it has a pure, clean line of acidity. It is bright, fruity and ready to drink.

title: Campo Alegre 2013 Verdejo (Rueda)
description: A clear color and agile, minerally aromas of pear and apple announce that this is mild and not too pushy. Elegant and fresh on the palate, this Verdejo tastes of orange, grapefruit and mango, while the finish is lasting and focused.

title: Vina Robles 2012 Huerhuero Petit Verdot (Paso Robles)
description: This bottling is dark and dense on the nose with black cherry, dried blueberry and espresso notes that balance the strong minerality of iron and volcanic rocks. It's quite lively on the sip, with tart blackberry juice and touches of tar.

title: Volatus 2007 Topgun Cuvée Red (Paso Robles)
description: This is a whopper of a wine, thanks to the high alcohol and long aging, with aromas of caramelized blueberries, black-cherry syrup and concentrated lilacs. The palate is thick with fudge and blackberry-jam flavors, with a decent energy cutting through the brooding tar and pipesmoke character.

title: Solminer 2014 Rubelite Syrah (Santa Ynez Valley)
description: An excellent wine for those seeking a snappy, tart take on Rhône grapes, this blend of 90% Syrah, 9% Grenache and 1% Riesling shows dried strawberries, plum and pencil shavings on the nose. The palate is tart with plum skin, asphalt and black rocks, a very intriguing style though not for those seeking a hearty Syrah.

title: Yalumba 2013 Patchwork Shiraz (Barossa)
description: This is a reliable bottling for lovers of Barossa Shiraz who don't want to drop more than a Jackson. It's full bodied and plush, with layers of blackberry fruit and vanilla oak, yet remains vibrant on the mocha-tinged finish. Drink now–2020.

title: TH 2013 The Pick Red (Paso Robles Willow Creek District)
description: Olallieberries, strawberry blossoms, caramel, maple syrup and cola shows on the complex nose of this blend of 52% Grenache, 31% Syrah, 12% Mourvèdre and 5% Counoise. The palate shows concentrated boysenberry, tar and coffee flavors, proving more tart than the region's usually powerful Rhône bottlings, and a refreshing change of pace.

title: La Rajade 2013 Caprizzi Riserva White (Collio)
description: This linear white offers aromas of chamomile flower, chopped herb and a whiff of citrus. On the palate, bright acidity supports lemon drop, thyme, almond and sage. An energizing mineral note closes the finish.

title: Quinta da Romeira 2014 Prova Régia Reserva Arinto (Bucelas)
description: The wine is smooth and creamy, its acidity just pointing up the ripe apple and pineapple fruit flavors. It does have a crisp citrus edge that just freshens the aftertaste. This is a wood-aged wine, the toast giving a light spice and nutmeg character. Drink this attractive wine now.

title: Quinta de Sant'Ana 2013 Tinto Red (Lisboa)
description: The wine has dark tannins and a firm structured texture. They act as a foil to the berry fruits and intense, young acidity. Dominated by Touriga Nacional and Aragonez, the wine has black fruits, juicy freshness and and an almost crisp aftertaste. It needs some time to fully integrate, so wait until 2017.

title: Plaisance Ranch 2013 Papa Joe's Private Stash Carmenère (Applegate Valley)
description: Big, bold and unreservedly stemmy, this Carmenère pulls in enough black-cherry fruit to balance out the herbs. The assertive tannins carry notes of earth, dried leaf and dark chocolate.

title: Plaisance Ranch 2013 Papa Joe's Private Stash Syrah (Applegate Valley)
description: A standout in the portfolio, this is a sleek, strong effort with tart purple fruits and mineral underpinnings. There's an ample whiff of smoke and a general earthiness around the tannins, with a hint of iron ore. The chalky finish is the only distraction.

title: Tzuba 2010 Metsuda Red (Judean Hills)
description: This blend of Cabernet Sauvignon, Merlot and Cabernet Franc has aromas of raspberry, cranberry and green pepper. Balanced fruit and savory flavors include cherry, raspberry, green pepper and grilled meats. Velvety tannins remain on the palate into a finish that is marked by a clean streak of brightness.

title: Château Marquis d'Alesme 2015 Barrel Sample  (Margaux)
description: 88–90. Barrel Sample. Light and fruity in character, this is a crisp wine that is likely to develop quickly. It has plenty of black currant character, but lacks a firmer structure to support the fruit.

title: Collavini 2014 Turian Ribolla Gialla (Friuli Colli Orientali)
description: Fragrant and linear, this has delicate scents of white spring flower and green apple while the bright palate offers white peach, pear and lemon peel. A light mineral note adds interest while zesty acidity gives it a tangy finish.

title: Domaine de la Tour Blanche 2012 Schoenenbourg Grand Cru Riesling (Alsace)
description: Very aromatic, gentle, almost floral notes of Cox's Orange Pippin appear with the first whiff. They get their full due on the off-dry palate which boosts the fruit flavors and paints them in a golden light. There is grip and backbone and ample fruit. Drink while the fruit is at its height: 2016–2018. Finishes off dry.

title: Château Ducluzeau 2015 Barrel Sample  (Listrac-Médoc)
description: 88–90. Barrel Sample. There is a good balance between fine tannins and tight acidity in this black currant-dominated wine. It is fresh, bright and has a crisp texture.

title: Belasco de Baquedano 2011 AR Guentota Old Vine Malbec (Luján de Cuyo)
description: Ripe blackberry and cola aromas comes across as foresty and nice as a whole. This saturated, dense Malbec shows brutish, choppy tannins along with flavors of blackberry, exotic spices and fig. The finish remains rough and turns hot. Drink through 2021.

title: Black Star Farms 2013 Arcturos Dry Riesling (Old Mission Peninsula)
description: Austere aromas of orchard blossoms ride over limestone and peach on the nose of this northern Michigan Riesling. There's breadth on the palate, giving way to ample stone-fruit flavors that are held in line against a backdrop of talc and lime. This is beautifully balanced, elegant and well integrated.

title: Bollig-Lehnert 2014 Trittenheimer Apotheke Kabinett Riesling (Mosel)
description: Savory wisps of smoke and dusty minerals juxtapose exuberantly juicy, sweet yellow peach and nectarine flavors in this crystalline kabinett. Just off-dry on the palate, its refreshing, high-spirited style makes it an excellent apéritif.

title: Brys 2012 Artisan Series Pinot Noir (Old Mission Peninsula)
description: As the top tier wine from this producer, this Pinot sees 10 months in new French oak which gives an inital char to the nose. With time in the glass this opens with notes of coffee-dusted red and black cherries. The medium-bodied palate is round and creamy in feel, with fuzzy, crushed-velvet tannins giving texture to the ripe cherry and racy currant flavors. A dusting of cocoa closes the finish.

title: Cantina Cortaccia 2014 Kofl Sauvignon (Alto Adige)
description: This radiant white opens with scents of stone fruit, blackcurrant, crushed herb and cut grass while the vibrant palate doles out honeydew melon, white peach, mineral and a hint of sage. Crisp acidity leaves a clean, tangy finish.

title: Cantina Produttori Bolzano 2014 Mock Sauvignon (Alto Adige)
description: Tomato vine, elderflower, cut grass and tropical fruit aromas lead the nose on this vibrant wine. The savory palate offers honeydew melon, peach, grapefruit and flinty mineral while zesty acidity gives it a tangy finish.

title: Casa da Passarella 2013 O Fugitivo Garrafeira Branco White (Dão)
description: This field blend is produced from old vines. It is rich and smooth with touches with spicy wood. The wood is showing strongly, perhaps not leaving enough room for fruit, however, that could improve as the wine ages more. Wait until 2017.

title: Castelfeder 2014 Lahm Kerner (Vigneti delle Dolomiti)
description: This offers fresh aromas of citrus, orchard fruit and mango. On the bright, linear palate, vibrant acidity underscores grapefruit, Kaiser pear and green apple. A mineral note closes the tangy finish.

title: Sturm 2014 Friulano (Collio)
description: White flower, Spanish Broom, chamomile, exotic fruit and a hint of hazelnut unfold in the glass. The linear, razor-sharp palate delivers Kaiser pear, citrus, sage and white almond while a salty mineral note closes the finish.

title: Subida di Monte 2014 Sauvignon (Collio)
description: Delicately perfumed, this offers aromas of yellow stone fruit, fig and a whiff of tomato vine. The bright, tangy palate delivers yellow peach, a hint of pineapple, chopped herb and mineral alongside crisp acidity. A salty note closes the finish.

title: Ironstone 2014 Chardonnay (Lodi)
description: There is a lot of life in this very affordable wine. Fruit-bowl and flower aromas lead to light spice and toast. The flavors are fruity and vivid, with the texture crisp and tangy, despite the full body.

title: Jean-Marc Bernhard 2013 Schlossberg Grand Cru Riesling (Alsace)
description: Very slight notes of lemon and apple on the nose acquire only slightly more currency on the palate. This is fresh, clean and dry with ample lemon notes accentuating tart apple fruit.

title: Kobler 2013 Anderson-Ross Vineyards Pinot Noir (Russian River Valley)
description: Layered and youthfully tannic, this vineyard-designate is minty and somewhat medicinal in aroma, before it ekes out more pleasant notes of anise and black tea. Full bodied and dark in color, it's a powerful wine from a powerful vintage and will benefit from having time to breathe.
